1.title: A Hint of Nuts
1.plot: Timber Creek Lodge opens for business as the staff tries to find the balance between five-star service and entertaining their first guests - U.S. Military alpha men celebrating a bachelor party. Assistant Lodge Manager Jamie attempts to navigate through Lodge Manager Katy's hands-off leadership style. Mark and Jenna spark up a not-so-secret romance. The VIP Mountain Hosts show the guests the time of their lives heli-skiing, slip n' sliding and partying, but their obsession with keeping the guests happy obstructs the "landscape" of their professionalism and puts the ...

2.title: The One Night Stand That Won't Go Away
2.plot: The staff has found their groove and everything is going well until Katy gets bad news. Everyone takes advantage of their first night off and secrets are revealed. Jenna decides to move out of their room and in with Mark's ex-girlfriend, Nikita. The next group of guests will put the staff to the test as caterer, Andrea and her family give Nikita a run for her money, while everyone else is adjusting to the new dynamics of the house.

3.title: Don't Poke the Bear
3.plot: The pressure is on for Nikita to make a flawless family-style Italian feast for caterer, Andrea, and her family. Jamie struggles to keep the standards of the lodge up to par as the staff disrespects his authority. Butting heads with Mark and Nikita leaves Jamie no choice but to call Joey for help. Mark starts to court Jenna and asks her on a real date. Cynthia's true colors come out.

4.title: Resting Chef Face
4.plot: After breaking the rules, Mark and Jenna must face the music from Lodge Manager Jamie, at the urging of Louise. Los Angeles fashionistas, the Nubry Bloggers, arrive with last minute demands that put the staff to the test. Not helping matters is a stubborn Nikita, who refuses to be a team player. Jamie tries to sort everything out, but tensions between Nikita and Louise finally boil over.

5.title: Pickly Like a Cactus
5.plot: Tensions with Nikita force Jamie to reach out to Joey Gibbons for a resolution. Louise loses her cool when the staff has to host two separate groups of guests. Everyone scrambles to keep outrageous rockers isolated from a wholesome Midwestern family. Cynthia and Colston devise a plan to find Tinder dates for each other. Jenna begins to question the accelerated pace of her relationship with Mark.

6.title: Not My First Hall Pass
6.plot: Mark reveals incidents from his past that shock Jenna. Wealthy Texans want a "Lone Star" experience at Timber Creek Lodge and insert themselves into the staff's personal lives - pushing Mark to his limit and to cross professional lines, putting the future of the Lodge in jeopardy. Colston has a connection with one of the guests, and Cynthia launches an investigation.

7.title: A Hard 7 at Best
7.plot: Timber Creek Lodge is double booked. Jamie struggles to make it through the last guests. Mark and Jenna face their biggest challenge after a guest shows Mark special attention. Emotions run high and professional lines are blurred as Blake's snowboarding Instagram posts get him into hot water and Colston finds he may have bitten off more than he can chew.

8.title: He Gave Her the Tip
8.plot: Marks's choices impact Timber Creek Lodge and bring him deep regret. Joey calls an end of the season meeting with the team, causing worry from several of the staff. Cynthia receives a heartbreaking text and does something completely out of character, which surprises Louise. Jenna settles the score with Mark.

imdb.plot outline: In Whistler, BC the staff of a popular resort lodge live and work together. They are encouraged to party with the guests that arrive every weekend, as well as serve them. But where does the line blur between staff and customer? And when the clients are gone, can the staff keep their hands off each other?
imdb.title: Timber Creek Lodge
plot: In Whistler, BC the staff of a popular resort lodge live and work together. They are encouraged to party with the guests that arrive every weekend, as well as serve them. But where does the line blur between staff and customer? And when the clients are gone, can the staff keep their hands off each other?::Ysa
